intro: Corunastylis capparina, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sunflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Corunastylis capparina is an important plant in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
